qas.question: What method is used to test software under a specific load?
What two methods can be used when using Load Testing?

answers.text: data or a large number of users

qas.question: What is called to test software functions when certain components increase in side?
What is Stable testing also called?
What method is used to test components under unexpected workloads?
What method is used to test firmware under a specific load?

plausible_answers.text: data or a large number of users

qas.question: What two methods cannot be used when using Load Testing?

plausible_answers.text: when certain components (for example a file or database) increase radically in size.

qas.question: Volume Testing is a way to test firmware when?
Testing reliability under expected or rare workload is called what?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Load testing<b5_0/><a0_0/> is primarily concerned with testing that the system can continue to operate under a specific load, whether that be large quantities of <a1_0><b6_0>data or a large number of users<b6_0/><a1_0/>. This is generally referred to as software scalability. The related load testing activity of when performed as a non-functional activity is often referred to as endurance testing. <a2_0>Volume testing<a2_0/> is a way to test software functions even <b7_0>when certain components (for example a file or database) increase radically in size.<b7_0/> <a4_0><b8_0>Stress testing<b8_0/><a4_0/> is a way to test reliability under unexpected or rare workloads. Stability testing (often referred to as load or <a3_0>endurance testing<a3_0/>) checks to see if the software can continuously function well in or above an acceptable period.
